item.title: 洛杉矶面临暴雨泥石流风险
item.description: 由于上个月毁灭性野火烧毁的土地周四普降大雨，引发了疏散命令，洛杉矶正准备应对可能发生的泥石流。【原文：Los Angeles is bracing for possible mudslides as heavy rain falls Thursday across land burned by last month’s devastating wildfires, triggering evacuation orders.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结招聘令野火救援人员陷入混乱
item.description:
联邦消防部队正面临着不确定性，火灾季节即将来临，而洛杉矶大火几乎还未从后视镜中消失。【原文：

The federal firefighting force is facing uncertainty with fire season just around the corner and the Los Angeles fires barely in the rearview mirror.

】

item.title: 特朗普与美国国家海洋和大气管理局的斗争远不止天气这么简单
item.description: 美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）已成为唐纳德-特朗普总统裁减联邦工作人员和对行政部门机构施加新限制计划的目标。【原文：The US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, or NOAA, has emerged as a target of President Donald Trump’s program of downsizing the federal workforce and imposing new restrictions on executive branch agencies.】

item.title: 加利福尼亚州 10 亿美元的保险公司救助加深了住房压力
item.description: 加州的住房市场已经是全国最昂贵的市场之一。旧金山一套公寓的价格相当于德克萨斯州一栋四居室的房子，一些家庭驱车数小时前往内陆地区，只为寻找一套起步房。【原文：California’s housing market is already one of the most expensive in the country. A San Francisco condo can cost as much as a four-bedroom house in Texas and families drive hours inland just to find a starter home.】

item.title: 匈牙利电池产量下滑，欧尔班的电动汽车希望破灭
item.description: 匈牙利电池行业的产量在去年年底急剧下降，削弱了总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）关于电动汽车需求将有助于扭转经济的赌注。【原文：Hungary’s battery-sector output plummeted at the end of last year, undermining Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s bet that demand for electric vehicles will help turn round the economy.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行与欧洲投资银行设立 10 亿欧元风能担保基金
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）和欧洲投资银行（European Investment Bank）正在合作建立一个 10 亿欧元（10 亿美元）的银行担保组合，旨在支持对欧盟风力发电场的投资。【原文：BNP Paribas SA and the European Investment Bank are partnering to create a €1 billion ($1 billion) portfolio of bank guarantees designed to back investments in EU wind farms.】

item.title: 摩根大通推出由前美国国家大气局科学主管撰写的气候说明
item.description:
"人们需要了解如何从战略角度思考气候问题，"现任该行首席气候顾问的萨拉-卡普尼克说。【原文：

“There is a demand for understanding how to strategically think about climate issues,” said Sarah Kapnick, now the bank’s top climate adviser.

】

item.title: 距离特朗普 8,745 英里的气候反击战
item.description: 在距离华盛顿特区数千英里之外，新西兰可能已经让世界看到了特朗普时代全球气候政策的模样。这个曾经在减排方面处于领先地位的国家，正在进行一系列绿色政策的逆转。请阅读下文。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上找到完整报道。更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Thousands of miles away from Washington, D.C., New Zealand may already be giving the world a glimpse of what global climate policy will look like in the Trump era. The nation, a one-time leader on emissions reductions, has been carrying out a series of green policy reversals. Read more below. You can also find the full story on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 英国向海上风电场支付创纪录的 19 亿英镑补贴
item.description: 去年，英国家庭为近海风电场支付了创纪录的 19 亿英镑（24 亿美元）补贴，以帮助其在可再生能源规模扩大和电力价格下降的情况下增强底气。【原文：UK households paid a record £1.9 billion ($2.4 billion) in subsidies to offshore wind farms last year to help bolster their bottom lines amid an expansion of the renewable energy fleet and a decline in power prices.】

item.title: 欧洲复兴开发银行称可再生能源是波兰降低电价的最佳选择
item.description: 欧洲复兴开发银行称，波兰若想迅速降低能源支出并取代即将停产的燃煤电厂，就应提高可再生能源发电能力。【原文：Poland should ramp up its renewable capacity if it wants to quickly cut energy bills and replace soon-to-be-defunct coal-fired plants, according to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.】

item.title: 绿色增长成本高昂。全球经济可以承受
item.description:
"我们金融体系中的资金和财富绰绰有余，但这些资金和财富却集中在世界上难以找到投资途径的地区，"联合国开发计划署署长阿奇姆-施泰纳在本周的《零点》节目中说道。【原文：

“There is more than enough money and wealth in our financial system, but it is concentrated in a part of the world that is struggling to find ways to invest,” Achim Steiner, head of the United Nations Development Program, says on this week’s Zero.

】

item.title: 美国环保局寻求从气候法中收回 200 亿美元赔偿金
item.description: 美国环保署署长李-泽尔丁（Lee Zeldin）周三晚间表示，环保署将试图收回根据乔-拜登总统签署的气候法授予气候项目的约 200 亿美元资金，并将这一努力定性为缺乏适当监督的 "阴谋"。【原文：The EPA will attempt to claw back some $20 billion in funding for climate projects awarded under President Joe Biden’s signature climate law, administrator Lee Zeldin said Wednesday evening, characterizing the effort as a “scheme” without proper oversight.】

item.title: 中国煤炭发电厂的蓬勃发展正在削弱清洁能源的推动力
item.description: 中国去年掀起了十年来最大规模的煤电建设热潮，加强了最脏化石燃料在能源结构中的作用，尽管中国的目标是向可再生能源过渡。【原文：China embarked last year on its biggest coal-power building boom in a decade, reinforcing the role of the dirtiest fossil fuel in its energy mix even as it aims to transition to renewables.】

item.title: 泽利亚增强为强力气旋，即将抵达澳大利亚
item.description: 气旋 "泽利亚 "在向澳大利亚铁矿石出口中心移动的过程中已增强为强风暴，预计将给沿海地区带来破坏性阵风和强降雨。【原文：Cyclone Zelia has strengthened into a severe storm as it tracks toward Australia’s iron ore export hub, and is expected to bring damaging wind gusts and heavy rainfall to the coastal region.】

item.title: 特朗普的气候退缩时代已在新西兰显现
item.description:
由于许多国家在绿色承诺上摇摆不定，曾经的全球减排领头羊出现了一系列政策逆转。【原文：

A one-time global leader on emissions reductions has carried out a series of policy reversals, as many nations waver on green commitments.

】

item.title: 美国国家海洋与大气管理局将重新命名墨西哥湾
item.description:
该机构正在 "尽快 "更新图表和天气产品，以反映特朗普关于使用美国湾的命令。【原文：

The agency is working “as quickly as possible” to update charts and weather products to reflect Trump’s order to use Gulf of America.

】

item.title: 公用事业公司称弗吉尼亚州数据中心电力需求几乎翻了一番
item.description: 弗吉尼亚州最大的公用事业公司是全球热点数据中心巷的所在地，在 2024 年下半年，开发中的数据中心的需求几乎翻了一番。【原文：The biggest utility in Virginia, home to the global hotspot Data Center Alley, saw demand from data centers in development almost double in the last half of 2024.】

item.title: 奈杰尔-法拉奇承诺对英国风电场征收暴利税
item.description: 奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）誓言，如果在下届大选中当选执政，他领导的英国改革党将对风力发电场征收暴利税，并拆除电力塔架，以此摆脱工党和保守党政府十多年来推行的可再生能源计划。【原文：Nigel Farage vowed that his Reform UK Party would impose a windfall tax on wind farms and tear down electricity pylons as part of a plan to break from the renewable energy drive pursued by Labour and Conservative governments for more than a decade, if elected to power at the next general election.】

item.title: 价格上涨之际，欧盟各国推动放宽天然气储存目标
item.description: 一个欧洲国家集团正在推动欧盟委员会在明年冬季到来之前允许天然气储存的再填充要求有更大的灵活性，因为快速消耗的库存和飙升的价格引起了人们对实现当前目标成本的担忧。【原文：A group of European nations is pushing the European Commission to allow more flexibility on refilling requirements for gas storage ahead of next winter, as rapidly depleting stockpiles and surging prices raise concerns about the cost of meeting the current targets.】

item.title: 微软支持的初创公司为森林碳减排融资 1.6 亿美元
item.description:
栗树公司将扩大业务，购买更多土地，以帮助恢复碳信用市场。【原文：

Chestnut will expand its operations and purchase more land in a bid to help rehabilitate the carbon credit market.

】

item.title: 中国锂业公司接管山寨版尼日利亚炼油厂项目
item.description: 两家中国制造商接管了一家尼日利亚公司，该公司于 2023 年开始在该国建设锂精炼厂，其名称与中国最大、最知名的生产商之一非常相似，这引起了人们的关注。【原文：Two Chinese manufacturers have taken over a Nigerian company that raised eyebrows in 2023 when it started building a lithium refinery in the country using a name that was very similar to one of the biggest and best-known Chinese producers.】

item.title: 欧盟将在 3 月底前提出 2040 年减排 90% 的中期目标
item.description: 欧盟行政部门将在 3 月底前提出一项法律，为欧盟设定到 2040 年减排 90% 的中期目标，以推进其雄心勃勃的气候议程。【原文：The European Union’s executive will propose a law by the end of March to set an interim emissions-reduction target for the bloc at 90% by 2040, advancing its ambitious climate agenda.】

item.title: 非洲头号棉花种植商准备以绿色推动力应对欧盟规则
item.description: 马里是非洲最大的棉花生产国，它计划投资清洁能源，解决童工和土壤健康等问题，使其棉花产量在欧洲市场更具竞争力。【原文：Mali, Africa’s biggest cotton producer, plans to invest in clean energy and tackle issues like child labor and soil health to make its output more competitive in the European market.】

item.title: 印度 ONGC 希望清洁能源支出增长 100 倍
item.description: 印度石油和天然气公司的目标是，到本十年末，将风能和太阳能等新能源项目的投资额提高 100 倍，以减少碳足迹。【原文：India’s Oil and Natural Gas Corp. aims to boost its investment in new energy projects like wind and solar power 100 times over by the end of the decade to cut its carbon footprint.】

item.title: 德国煤炭运营商就发电厂待机状态起诉监管机构
item.description: 德国公用事业公司 Steag GmbH 表示，它正在起诉该国的能源监管机构，因为后者将其燃煤发电厂置于待机状态，而不是完全关闭。【原文：German utility Steag GmbH said it’s suing the country’s energy regulator for putting its coal-fired power plants on standby instead of switching them off entirely.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑减轻企业在最严格的环境、社会和治理法律下的责任
item.description: 欧盟正在审查公司对其供应链中的环境和人权违规行为承担责任的程度，此前欧盟正在制定一揽子计划，旨在消除欧盟环境、社会和公司治理监管框架中的繁文缛节。【原文：The European Union is reviewing the extent to which companies can be held liable for environmental and human rights breaches in their supply chains, ahead of a package designed to remove red tape from the bloc’s ESG regulatory framework.】

item.title: 美国碳公司看好印度在特朗普气候政策回调中的发展前景
item.description: 美国碳回收公司LanzaTech Global Inc.看到了在世界第三大碳排放国印度扩张的机会，因为在唐纳德-特朗普总统的气候回调之后，美国清洁能源技术的不确定性正在增加。【原文：US carbon recycling firm LanzaTech Global Inc. sees an opportunity to expand in India, the world’s third-largest emitter, as uncertainty over clean energy technology in the US grows following President Donald Trump’s climate pullback.】

item.title: 欧盟面临监管倒退，绿色成为地雷中的金丝雀
item.description: 从碳中和到社会不公平，欧洲在监管方面所做的全面努力曾一度被誉为为世界其他地区制定了议程。【原文：Europe’s sweeping efforts to regulate for everything from carbon neutrality to social inequity were once hailed as setting the agenda for the rest of the world.】

item.title: 特朗普的贸易战可能会减缓亚洲碳市场的发展
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税措施可能会减缓碳市场在亚太地区的采用和扩展，而亚太地区的排放量占全球排放量的五分之三，一直是碳交易增长的主要推动力。【原文：President Donald Trump’s tariff measures may slow the adoption and expansion of carbon markets in the Asia-Pacific region, which accounts for three-fifths of global emissions and has been a key driver of growth in trading.】

item.title: 热带气旋 "泽利亚 "在澳大利亚主要铁矿石枢纽附近海域形成
item.description: 一个热带气旋已在西澳大利亚近海形成，预计将于周五横穿海岸，给该国主要的铁矿石出口中心带来暴雨和破坏性阵风。【原文：A tropical cyclone has formed off Western Australia and is expected to cross the coast on Friday, bringing heavy rain and damaging wind gusts to the nation’s major iron ore export hub.】
